4187  * Returns TRUE if the top line and top fill of window 'wp' matches the saved
4188  * topline and topfill.
4189  */
4190  int
4191 is_mouse_topline(win_T *wp)
4192 {
4193  return orig_topline == wp->w_topline
4194 #ifdef FEAT_DIFF
4195  && orig_topfill == wp->w_topfill
4196 #endif
4197  ;
4198 }
4199 #endif
4200 
4201 /*
4202  * Check if typebuf.tb_buf[] contains a terminal key code.
4203  * Check from typebuf.tb_buf[typebuf.tb_off] to typebuf.tb_buf[typebuf.tb_off
4204  * + max_offset].
4205  * Return 0 for no match, -1 for partial match, > 0 for full match.
4206  * Return KEYLEN_REMOVED when a key code was deleted.
4207  * With a match, the match is removed, the replacement code is inserted in
4208  * typebuf.tb_buf[] and the number of characters in typebuf.tb_buf[] is
4209  * returned.
4210  * When "buf" is not NULL, buf[bufsize] is used instead of typebuf.tb_buf[].
4211  * "buflen" is then the length of the string in buf[] and is updated for
4212  * inserts and deletes.
4213  */
4214  int
4215 check_termcode(
4216  int max_offset,
4217  char_u *buf,
4218  int bufsize,
4219  int *buflen)
4220 {
4221  char_u *tp;
4222  char_u *p;
4223  int slen = 0; /* init for GCC */
4224  int modslen;
4225  int len;
4226  int retval = 0;
4227  int offset;
4228  char_u key_name[2];
4229  int modifiers;
4230  char_u *modifiers_start = NULL;
4231  int key;
4232  int new_slen;
4233  int extra;
4234  char_u string[MAX_KEY_CODE_LEN + 1];
4235  int i, j;
4236  int idx = 0;
4237  int cpo_koffset;
4238 
4239  cpo_koffset = (vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_KOFFSET) != NULL);
4240 
4241  /*
4242  * Speed up the checks for terminal codes by gathering all first bytes
4243  * used in termleader[]. Often this is just a single <Esc>.
4244  */
4245  if (need_gather)
4246  gather_termleader();
4247 
4248  /*
4249  * Check at several positions in typebuf.tb_buf[], to catch something like
4250  * "x<Up>" that can be mapped. Stop at max_offset, because characters
4251  * after that cannot be used for mapping, and with @r commands
4252  * typebuf.tb_buf[] can become very long.
4253  * This is used often, KEEP IT FAST!
4254  */
4255  for (offset = 0; offset < max_offset; ++offset)
4256  {
4257  if (buf == NULL)
4258  {
4259  if (offset >= typebuf.tb_len)
4260  break;
4261  tp = typebuf.tb_buf + typebuf.tb_off + offset;
4262  len = typebuf.tb_len - offset; /* length of the input */
4263  }
4264  else
4265  {
4266  if (offset >= *buflen)
4267  break;
4268  tp = buf + offset;
4269  len = *buflen - offset;
4270  }
4271 
4272  /*
4273  * Don't check characters after K_SPECIAL, those are already
4274  * translated terminal chars (avoid translating ~@^Hx).
4275  */
4276  if (*tp == K_SPECIAL)
4277  {
4278  offset += 2; /* there are always 2 extra characters */
4279  continue;
4280  }
4281 
4282  /*
4283  * Skip this position if the character does not appear as the first
4284  * character in term_strings. This speeds up a lot, since most
4285  * termcodes start with the same character (ESC or CSI).
4286  */
4287  i = *tp;
4288  for (p = termleader; *p && *p != i; ++p)
4289  ;
4290  if (*p == NUL)
4291  continue;
4292 
4293  /*
4294  * Skip this position if p_ek is not set and tp[0] is an ESC and we
4295  * are in Insert mode.
4296  */
4297  if (*tp == ESC && !p_ek && (State & INSERT))
4298  continue;
4299 
4300  key_name[0] = NUL; /* no key name found yet */
4301  key_name[1] = NUL; /* no key name found yet */
4302  modifiers = 0; /* no modifiers yet */
4303 
4304 #ifdef FEAT_GUI
4305  if (gui.in_use)
4306  {
4307  /*
4308  * GUI special key codes are all of the form [CSI xx].
4309  */
4310  if (*tp == CSI) /* Special key from GUI */
4311  {
4312  if (len < 3)
4313  return -1; /* Shouldn't happen */
4314  slen = 3;
4315  key_name[0] = tp[1];
4316  key_name[1] = tp[2];
4317  }
4318  }
4319  else
4320 #endif /* FEAT_GUI */
4321  {
4322  for (idx = 0; idx < tc_len; ++idx)
4323  {
4324  /*
4325  * Ignore the entry if we are not at the start of
4326  * typebuf.tb_buf[]
4327  * and there are not enough characters to make a match.
4328  * But only when the 'K' flag is in 'cpoptions'.
4329  */
4330  slen = termcodes[idx].len;
4331  modifiers_start = NULL;
4332  if (cpo_koffset && offset && len < slen)
4333  continue;
4334  if (STRNCMP(termcodes[idx].code, tp,
4335  (size_t)(slen > len ? len : slen)) == 0)
4336  {
4337  if (len < slen) /* got a partial sequence */
4338  return -1; /* need to get more chars */
4339 
4340  /*
4341  * When found a keypad key, check if there is another key
4342  * that matches and use that one. This makes <Home> to be
4343  * found instead of <kHome> when they produce the same
4344  * key code.
4345  */
4346  if (termcodes[idx].name[0] == 'K'
4347  && VIM_ISDIGIT(termcodes[idx].name[1]))
4348  {
4349  for (j = idx + 1; j < tc_len; ++j)
4350  if (termcodes[j].len == slen &&
4351  STRNCMP(termcodes[idx].code,
4352  termcodes[j].code, slen) == 0)
4353  {
4354  idx = j;
4355  break;
4356  }
4357  }
4358 
4359  key_name[0] = termcodes[idx].name[0];
4360  key_name[1] = termcodes[idx].name[1];
4361  break;
4362  }
4363 
4364  /*
4365  * Check for code with modifier, like xterm uses:
4366  * <Esc>[123;*X (modslen == slen - 3)
4367  * Also <Esc>O*X and <M-O>*X (modslen == slen - 2).
4368  * When there is a modifier the * matches a number.
4369  * When there is no modifier the ;* or * is omitted.
4370  */
4371  if (termcodes[idx].modlen > 0)
4372  {
4373  modslen = termcodes[idx].modlen;
4374  if (cpo_koffset && offset && len < modslen)
4375  continue;
4376  if (STRNCMP(termcodes[idx].code, tp,
4377  (size_t)(modslen > len ? len : modslen)) == 0)
4378  {
4379  int n;
4380 
4381  if (len <= modslen) /* got a partial sequence */
4382  return -1; /* need to get more chars */
4383 
4384  if (tp[modslen] == termcodes[idx].code[slen - 1])
4385  slen = modslen + 1; /* no modifiers */
4386  else if (tp[modslen] != ';' && modslen == slen - 3)
4387  continue; /* no match */
4388  else
4389  {
4390  // Skip over the digits, the final char must
4391  // follow. URXVT can use a negative value, thus
4392  // also accept '-'.
4393  for (j = slen - 2; j < len && (isdigit(tp[j])
4394  || tp[j] == '-' || tp[j] == ';'); ++j)
4395  ;
4396  ++j;
4397  if (len < j) /* got a partial sequence */
4398  return -1; /* need to get more chars */
4399  if (tp[j - 1] != termcodes[idx].code[slen - 1])
4400  continue; /* no match */
4401 
4402  modifiers_start = tp + slen - 2;
4403 
4404  /* Match! Convert modifier bits. */
4405  n = atoi((char *)modifiers_start) - 1;
4406  if (n & 1)
4407  modifiers |= MOD_MASK_SHIFT;
4408  if (n & 2)
4409  modifiers |= MOD_MASK_ALT;
4410  if (n & 4)
4411  modifiers |= MOD_MASK_CTRL;
4412  if (n & 8)
4413  modifiers |= MOD_MASK_META;
4414 
4415  slen = j;
4416  }
4417  key_name[0] = termcodes[idx].name[0];
4418  key_name[1] = termcodes[idx].name[1];
4419  break;
4420  }
4421  }
4422  }
4423  }
4424 
4425 #ifdef FEAT_TERMRESPONSE
4426  if (key_name[0] == NUL
4427  /* Mouse codes of DEC and pterm start with <ESC>[. When
4428  * detecting the start of these mouse codes they might as well be
4429  * another key code or terminal response. */
4430 # ifdef FEAT_MOUSE_DEC
4431  || key_name[0] == KS_DEC_MOUSE
4432 # endif
4433 # ifdef FEAT_MOUSE_PTERM
4434  || key_name[0] == KS_PTERM_MOUSE
4435 # endif
4436  )
4437  {
4438  /* Check for some responses from the terminal starting with
4439  * "<Esc>[" or CSI:
4440  *
4441  * - Xterm version string: <Esc>[>{x};{vers};{y}c
4442  * Libvterm returns {x} == 0, {vers} == 100, {y} == 0.
4443  * Also eat other possible responses to t_RV, rxvt returns
4444  * "<Esc>[?1;2c". Also accept CSI instead of <Esc>[.
4445  * mrxvt has been reported to have "+" in the version. Assume
4446  * the escape sequence ends with a letter or one of "{|}~".
4447  *
4448  * - Cursor position report: <Esc>[{row};{col}R
4449  * The final byte must be 'R'. It is used for checking the
4450  * ambiguous-width character state.
4451  *
4452  * - window position reply: <Esc>[3;{x};{y}t
4453  */
4454  char_u *argp = tp[0] == ESC ? tp + 2 : tp + 1;
4455 
4456  if ((*T_CRV != NUL || *T_U7 != NUL || did_request_winpos)
4457  && ((tp[0] == ESC && len >= 3 && tp[1] == '[')
4458  || (tp[0] == CSI && len >= 2))
4459  && (VIM_ISDIGIT(*argp) || *argp == '>' || *argp == '?'))
4460  {
4461  int col = 0;
4462  int semicols = 0;
4463  int row_char = NUL;
4464 
4465  extra = 0;
4466  for (i = 2 + (tp[0] != CSI); i < len
4467  && !(tp[i] >= '{' && tp[i] <= '~')
4468  && !ASCII_ISALPHA(tp[i]); ++i)
4469  if (tp[i] == ';' && ++semicols == 1)
4470  {
4471  extra = i + 1;
4472  row_char = tp[i - 1];
4473  }
4474  if (i == len)
4475  {
4476  LOG_TR(("Not enough characters for CRV"));
4477  return -1;
4478  }
4479  if (extra > 0)
4480  col = atoi((char *)tp + extra);
4481 
4482  /* Eat it when it has 2 arguments and ends in 'R'. Also when
4483  * u7_status is not "sent", it may be from a previous Vim that
4484  * just exited. But not for <S-F3>, it sends something
4485  * similar, check for row and column to make sense. */
4486  if (semicols == 1 && tp[i] == 'R')
4487  {
4488  if (row_char == '2' && col >= 2)
4489  {
4490  char *aw = NULL;
4491 
4492  LOG_TR(("Received U7 status: %s", tp));
4493  u7_status.tr_progress = STATUS_GOT;
4494  did_cursorhold = TRUE;
4495  if (col == 2)
4496  aw = "single";
4497  else if (col == 3)
4498  aw = "double";
4499  if (aw != NULL && STRCMP(aw, p_ambw) != 0)
4500  {
4501  /* Setting the option causes a screen redraw. Do
4502  * that right away if possible, keeping any
4503  * messages. */
4504  set_option_value((char_u *)"ambw", 0L,
4505  (char_u *)aw, 0);
4506 # ifdef DEBUG_TERMRESPONSE
4507  {
4508  int r = redraw_asap(CLEAR);
4509 
4510  log_tr("set 'ambiwidth', redraw_asap(): %d", r);
4511  }
4512 # else
4513  redraw_asap(CLEAR);
4514 # endif
4515  }
4516  }
4517  key_name[0] = (int)KS_EXTRA;
4518  key_name[1] = (int)KE_IGNORE;
4519  slen = i + 1;
4520 # ifdef FEAT_EVAL
4521  set_vim_var_string(VV_TERMU7RESP, tp, slen);
4522 # endif
4523  }
4524  /* eat it when at least one digit and ending in 'c' */
4525  else if (*T_CRV != NUL && i > 2 + (tp[0] != CSI)
4526  && tp[i] == 'c')
4527  {
4528  int version = col;
4529 
4530  LOG_TR(("Received CRV response: %s", tp));
4531  crv_status.tr_progress = STATUS_GOT;
4532  did_cursorhold = TRUE;
4533 
4534  /* If this code starts with CSI, you can bet that the
4535  * terminal uses 8-bit codes. */
4536  if (tp[0] == CSI)
4537  switch_to_8bit();
4538 
4539  /* rxvt sends its version number: "20703" is 2.7.3.
4540  * Screen sends 40500.
4541  * Ignore it for when the user has set 'term' to xterm,
4542  * even though it's an rxvt. */
4543  if (version > 20000)
4544  version = 0;
4545 
4546  if (tp[1 + (tp[0] != CSI)] == '>' && semicols == 2)
4547  {
4548  int need_flush = FALSE;
4549  int is_iterm2 = FALSE;
4550  int is_mintty = FALSE;
4551 
4552  // mintty 2.9.5 sends 77;20905;0c.
4553  // (77 is ASCII 'M' for mintty.)
4554  if (STRNCMP(tp + extra - 3, "77;", 3) == 0)
4555  is_mintty = TRUE;
4556 
4557  /* if xterm version >= 141 try to get termcap codes */
4558  if (version >= 141)
4559  {
4560  LOG_TR(("Enable checking for XT codes"));
4561  check_for_codes = TRUE;
4562  need_gather = TRUE;
4563  req_codes_from_term();
4564  }
4565 
4566  /* libvterm sends 0;100;0 */
4567  if (version == 100
4568  && STRNCMP(tp + extra - 2, "0;100;0c", 8) == 0)
4569  {
4570  /* If run from Vim $COLORS is set to the number of
4571  * colors the terminal supports. Otherwise assume
4572  * 256, libvterm supports even more. */
4573  if (mch_getenv((char_u *)"COLORS") == NULL)
4574  may_adjust_color_count(256);
4575  /* Libvterm can handle SGR mouse reporting. */
4576  if (!option_was_set((char_u *)"ttym"))
4577  set_option_value((char_u *)"ttym", 0L,
4578  (char_u *)"sgr", 0);
4579  }
4580 
4581  if (version == 95)
4582  {
4583  // Mac Terminal.app sends 1;95;0
4584  if (STRNCMP(tp + extra - 2, "1;95;0c", 7) == 0)
4585  {
4586  is_not_xterm = TRUE;
4587  is_mac_terminal = TRUE;
4588  }
4589  // iTerm2 sends 0;95;0
4590  if (STRNCMP(tp + extra - 2, "0;95;0c", 7) == 0)
4591  is_iterm2 = TRUE;
4592  // old iTerm2 sends 0;95;
4593  else if (STRNCMP(tp + extra - 2, "0;95;c", 6) == 0)
4594  is_not_xterm = TRUE;
4595  }
4596 
4597  /* Only set 'ttymouse' automatically if it was not set
4598  * by the user already. */
4599  if (!option_was_set((char_u *)"ttym"))
4600  {
4601  /* Xterm version 277 supports SGR. Also support
4602  * Terminal.app, iTerm2 and mintty. */
4603  if (version >= 277 || is_iterm2 || is_mac_terminal
4604  || is_mintty)
4605  set_option_value((char_u *)"ttym", 0L,
4606  (char_u *)"sgr", 0);
4607  /* if xterm version >= 95 use mouse dragging */
4608  else if (version >= 95)
4609  set_option_value((char_u *)"ttym", 0L,
4610  (char_u *)"xterm2", 0);
4611  }
4612 
4613  /* Detect terminals that set $TERM to something like
4614  * "xterm-256colors" but are not fully xterm
4615  * compatible. */
4616 
4617  /* Gnome terminal sends 1;3801;0, 1;4402;0 or 1;2501;0.
4618  * xfce4-terminal sends 1;2802;0.
4619  * screen sends 83;40500;0
4620  * Assuming any version number over 2500 is not an
4621  * xterm (without the limit for rxvt and screen). */
4622  if (col >= 2500)
4623  is_not_xterm = TRUE;
4624 
4625  /* PuTTY sends 0;136;0
4626  * vandyke SecureCRT sends 1;136;0 */
4627  if (version == 136
4628  && STRNCMP(tp + extra - 1, ";136;0c", 7) == 0)
4629  is_not_xterm = TRUE;
4630 
4631  /* Konsole sends 0;115;0 */
4632  if (version == 115
4633  && STRNCMP(tp + extra - 2, "0;115;0c", 8) == 0)
4634  is_not_xterm = TRUE;
4635 
4636  // Xterm first responded to this request at patch level
4637  // 95, so assume anything below 95 is not xterm.
4638  if (version < 95)
4639  is_not_xterm = TRUE;
4640 
4641  /* Only request the cursor style if t_SH and t_RS are
4642  * set. Only supported properly by xterm since version
4643  * 279 (otherwise it returns 0x18).
4644  * Not for Terminal.app, it can't handle t_RS, it
4645  * echoes the characters to the screen. */
4646  if (rcs_status.tr_progress == STATUS_GET
4647  && version >= 279
4648  && !is_not_xterm
4649  && *T_CSH != NUL
4650  && *T_CRS != NUL)
4651  {
4652  LOG_TR(("Sending cursor style request"));
4653  out_str(T_CRS);
4654  termrequest_sent(&rcs_status);
4655  need_flush = TRUE;
4656  }
4657 
4658  /* Only request the cursor blink mode if t_RC set. Not
4659  * for Gnome terminal, it can't handle t_RC, it
4660  * echoes the characters to the screen. */
4661  if (rbm_status.tr_progress == STATUS_GET
4662  && !is_not_xterm
4663  && *T_CRC != NUL)
4664  {
4665  LOG_TR(("Sending cursor blink mode request"));
4666  out_str(T_CRC);
4667  termrequest_sent(&rbm_status);
4668  need_flush = TRUE;
4669  }
4670 
4671  if (need_flush)
4672  out_flush();
4673  }
4674  slen = i + 1;
4675 # ifdef FEAT_EVAL
4676  set_vim_var_string(VV_TERMRESPONSE, tp, slen);
4677 # endif
4678  apply_autocmds(EVENT_TERMRESPONSE,
4679  NULL, NULL, FALSE, curbuf);
4680  key_name[0] = (int)KS_EXTRA;
4681  key_name[1] = (int)KE_IGNORE;
4682  }
4683 
4684  /* Check blinking cursor from xterm:
4685  * {lead}?12;1$y set
4686  * {lead}?12;2$y not set
4687  *
4688  * {lead} can be <Esc>[ or CSI
4689  */
4690  else if (rbm_status.tr_progress == STATUS_SENT
4691  && tp[(j = 1 + (tp[0] == ESC))] == '?'
4692  && i == j + 6
4693  && tp[j + 1] == '1'
4694  && tp[j + 2] == '2'
4695  && tp[j + 3] == ';'
4696  && tp[i - 1] == '$'
4697  && tp[i] == 'y')
4698  {
4699  initial_cursor_blink = (tp[j + 4] == '1');
4700  rbm_status.tr_progress = STATUS_GOT;
4701  LOG_TR(("Received cursor blinking mode response: %s", tp));
4702  key_name[0] = (int)KS_EXTRA;
4703  key_name[1] = (int)KE_IGNORE;
4704  slen = i + 1;
4705 # ifdef FEAT_EVAL
4706  set_vim_var_string(VV_TERMBLINKRESP, tp, slen);
4707 # endif
4708  }
4709 
4710  /*
4711  * Check for a window position response from the terminal:
4712  * {lead}3;{x};{y}t
4713  */
4714  else if (did_request_winpos
4715  && ((len >= 4 && tp[0] == ESC && tp[1] == '[')
4716  || (len >= 3 && tp[0] == CSI))
4717  && tp[(j = 1 + (tp[0] == ESC))] == '3'
4718  && tp[j + 1] == ';')
4719  {
4720  j += 2;
4721  for (i = j; i < len && vim_isdigit(tp[i]); ++i)
4722  ;
4723  if (i < len && tp[i] == ';')
4724  {
4725  winpos_x = atoi((char *)tp + j);
4726  j = i + 1;
4727  for (i = j; i < len && vim_isdigit(tp[i]); ++i)
4728  ;
4729  if (i < len && tp[i] == 't')
4730  {
4731  winpos_y = atoi((char *)tp + j);
4732  /* got finished code: consume it */
4733  key_name[0] = (int)KS_EXTRA;
4734  key_name[1] = (int)KE_IGNORE;
4735  slen = i + 1;
4736 
4737  if (--did_request_winpos <= 0)
4738  winpos_status.tr_progress = STATUS_GOT;
4739  }
4740  }
4741  if (i == len)
4742  {
4743  LOG_TR(("not enough characters for winpos"));
4744  return -1;
4745  }
4746  }
4747  }
4748 
4749  /* Check for fore/background color response from the terminal:
4750  *
4751  * {lead}{code};rgb:{rrrr}/{gggg}/{bbbb}{tail}
4752  * or {lead}{code};rgb:{rr}/{gg}/{bb}{tail}
4753  *
4754  * {code} is 10 for foreground, 11 for background
4755  * {lead} can be <Esc>] or OSC
4756  * {tail} can be '\007', <Esc>\ or STERM.
4757  *
4758  * Consume any code that starts with "{lead}11;", it's also
4759  * possible that "rgba" is following.
4760  */
4761  else if ((*T_RBG != NUL || *T_RFG != NUL)
4762  && ((tp[0] == ESC && len >= 2 && tp[1] == ']')
4763  || tp[0] == OSC))
4764  {
4765  j = 1 + (tp[0] == ESC);
4766  if (len >= j + 3 && (argp[0] != '1'
4767  || (argp[1] != '1' && argp[1] != '0')
4768  || argp[2] != ';'))
4769  i = 0; /* no match */
4770  else
4771  for (i = j; i < len; ++i)
4772  if (tp[i] == '\007' || (tp[0] == OSC ? tp[i] == STERM
4773  : (tp[i] == ESC && i + 1 < len && tp[i + 1] == '\\')))
4774  {
4775  int is_bg = argp[1] == '1';
4776  int is_4digit = i - j >= 21 && tp[j + 11] == '/'
4777  && tp[j + 16] == '/';
4778 
4779  if (i - j >= 15 && STRNCMP(tp + j + 3, "rgb:", 4) == 0
4780  && (is_4digit
4781  || (tp[j + 9] == '/' && tp[i + 12 == '/'])))
4782  {
4783  char_u *tp_r = tp + j + 7;
4784  char_u *tp_g = tp + j + (is_4digit ? 12 : 10);
4785  char_u *tp_b = tp + j + (is_4digit ? 17 : 13);
4786 # ifdef FEAT_TERMINAL
4787  int rval, gval, bval;
4788 
4789  rval = hexhex2nr(tp_r);
4790  gval = hexhex2nr(tp_b);
4791  bval = hexhex2nr(tp_g);
4792 # endif
4793  if (is_bg)
4794  {
4795  char *new_bg_val = (3 * '6' < *tp_r + *tp_g +
4796  *tp_b) ? "light" : "dark";
4797 
4798  LOG_TR(("Received RBG response: %s", tp));
4799  rbg_status.tr_progress = STATUS_GOT;
4800 # ifdef FEAT_TERMINAL
4801  bg_r = rval;
4802  bg_g = gval;
4803  bg_b = bval;
4804 # endif
4805  if (!option_was_set((char_u *)"bg")
4806  && STRCMP(p_bg, new_bg_val) != 0)
4807  {
4808  /* value differs, apply it */
4809  set_option_value((char_u *)"bg", 0L,
4810  (char_u *)new_bg_val, 0);
4811  reset_option_was_set((char_u *)"bg");
4812  redraw_asap(CLEAR);
4813  }
4814  }
4815 # ifdef FEAT_TERMINAL
4816  else
4817  {
4818  LOG_TR(("Received RFG response: %s", tp));
4819  rfg_status.tr_progress = STATUS_GOT;
4820  fg_r = rval;
4821  fg_g = gval;
4822  fg_b = bval;
4823  }
4824 # endif
4825  }
4826 
4827  /* got finished code: consume it */
4828  key_name[0] = (int)KS_EXTRA;
4829  key_name[1] = (int)KE_IGNORE;
4830  slen = i + 1 + (tp[i] == ESC);
4831 # ifdef FEAT_EVAL
4832  set_vim_var_string(is_bg ? VV_TERMRBGRESP
4833  : VV_TERMRFGRESP, tp, slen);
4834 # endif
4835  break;
4836  }
4837  if (i == len)
4838  {
4839  LOG_TR(("not enough characters for RB"));
4840  return -1;
4841  }
4842  }
4843 
4844  /* Check for key code response from xterm:
4845  * {lead}{flag}+r<hex bytes><{tail}
4846  *
4847  * {lead} can be <Esc>P or DCS
4848  * {flag} can be '0' or '1'
4849  * {tail} can be Esc>\ or STERM
4850  *
4851  * Check for cursor shape response from xterm:
4852  * {lead}1$r<digit> q{tail}
4853  *
4854  * {lead} can be <Esc>P or DCS
4855  * {tail} can be <Esc>\ or STERM
4856  *
4857  * Consume any code that starts with "{lead}.+r" or "{lead}.$r".
4858  */
4859  else if ((check_for_codes || rcs_status.tr_progress == STATUS_SENT)
4860  && ((tp[0] == ESC && len >= 2 && tp[1] == 'P')
4861  || tp[0] == DCS))
4862  {
4863  j = 1 + (tp[0] == ESC);
4864  if (len < j + 3)
4865  i = len; // need more chars
4866  else if ((argp[1] != '+' && argp[1] != '$') || argp[2] != 'r')
4867  i = 0; // no match
4868  else if (argp[1] == '+')
4869  // key code response
4870  for (i = j; i < len; ++i)
4871  {
4872  if ((tp[i] == ESC && i + 1 < len && tp[i + 1] == '\\')
4873  || tp[i] == STERM)
4874  {
4875  if (i - j >= 3)
4876  got_code_from_term(tp + j, i);
4877  key_name[0] = (int)KS_EXTRA;
4878  key_name[1] = (int)KE_IGNORE;
4879  slen = i + 1 + (tp[i] == ESC);
4880  break;
4881  }
4882  }
4883  else
4884  {
4885  // Probably the cursor shape response. Make sure that "i"
4886  // is equal to "len" when there are not sufficient
4887  // characters.
4888  for (i = j + 3; i < len; ++i)
4889  {
4890  if (i - j == 3 && !isdigit(tp[i]))
4891  break;
4892  if (i - j == 4 && tp[i] != ' ')
4893  break;
4894  if (i - j == 5 && tp[i] != 'q')
4895  break;
4896  if (i - j == 6 && tp[i] != ESC && tp[i] != STERM)
4897  break;
4898  if ((i - j == 6 && tp[i] == STERM)
4899  || (i - j == 7 && tp[i] == '\\'))
4900  {
4901  int number = argp[3] - '0';
4902 
4903  // 0, 1 = block blink, 2 = block
4904  // 3 = underline blink, 4 = underline
4905  // 5 = vertical bar blink, 6 = vertical bar
4906  number = number == 0 ? 1 : number;
4907  initial_cursor_shape = (number + 1) / 2;
4908  // The blink flag is actually inverted, compared to
4909  // the value set with T_SH.
4910  initial_cursor_shape_blink =
4911  (number & 1) ? FALSE : TRUE;
4912  rcs_status.tr_progress = STATUS_GOT;
4913  LOG_TR(("Received cursor shape response: %s", tp));
4914 
4915  key_name[0] = (int)KS_EXTRA;
4916  key_name[1] = (int)KE_IGNORE;
4917  slen = i + 1;
4918 # ifdef FEAT_EVAL
4919  set_vim_var_string(VV_TERMSTYLERESP, tp, slen);
4920 # endif
4921  break;
4922  }
4923  }
4924  }
4925 
4926  if (i == len)
4927  {
4928  /* These codes arrive many together, each code can be
4929  * truncated at any point. */
4930  LOG_TR(("not enough characters for XT"));
4931  return -1;
4932  }
4933  }
4934  }
4935 #endif
4936 
4937  if (key_name[0] == NUL)
4938  continue; /* No match at this position, try next one */
4939 
4940  /* We only get here when we have a complete termcode match */
4941 
4942 #ifdef FEAT_MOUSE
4943 # ifdef FEAT_GUI
4944  /*
4945  * Only in the GUI: Fetch the pointer coordinates of the scroll event
4946  * so that we know which window to scroll later.
4947  */
4948  if (gui.in_use
4949  && key_name[0] == (int)KS_EXTRA
4950  && (key_name[1] == (int)KE_X1MOUSE
4951  || key_name[1] == (int)KE_X2MOUSE
4952  || key_name[1] == (int)KE_MOUSELEFT
4953  || key_name[1] == (int)KE_MOUSERIGHT
4954  || key_name[1] == (int)KE_MOUSEDOWN
4955  || key_name[1] == (int)KE_MOUSEUP))
4956  {
4957  char_u bytes[6];
4958  int num_bytes = get_bytes_from_buf(tp + slen, bytes, 4);
4959 
4960  if (num_bytes == -1) // not enough coordinates
4961  return -1;
4962  mouse_col = 128 * (bytes[0] - ' ' - 1) + bytes[1] - ' ' - 1;
4963  mouse_row = 128 * (bytes[2] - ' ' - 1) + bytes[3] - ' ' - 1;
4964  slen += num_bytes;
4965  }
4966  else
4967 # endif
4968  /*
4969  * If it is a mouse click, get the coordinates.
4970  */
4971  if (key_name[0] == KS_MOUSE
4972 # ifdef FEAT_MOUSE_GPM
4973  || key_name[0] == KS_GPM_MOUSE
4974 # endif
4975 # ifdef FEAT_MOUSE_JSB
4976  || key_name[0] == KS_JSBTERM_MOUSE
4977 # endif
4978 # ifdef FEAT_MOUSE_NET
4979  || key_name[0] == KS_NETTERM_MOUSE
4980 # endif
4981 # ifdef FEAT_MOUSE_DEC
4982  || key_name[0] == KS_DEC_MOUSE
4983 # endif
4984 # ifdef FEAT_MOUSE_PTERM
4985  || key_name[0] == KS_PTERM_MOUSE
4986 # endif
4987 # ifdef FEAT_MOUSE_URXVT
4988  || key_name[0] == KS_URXVT_MOUSE
4989 # endif
4990  || key_name[0] == KS_SGR_MOUSE
4991  || key_name[0] == KS_SGR_MOUSE_RELEASE)
4992  {
4993  if (check_termcode_mouse(tp, &slen, key_name, modifiers_start, idx,
4994  &modifiers) == -1)
4995  return -1;
4996  }
4997 #endif /* FEAT_MOUSE */
4998 
4999 #ifdef FEAT_GUI
5000  /*
5001  * If using the GUI, then we get menu and scrollbar events.
5002  *
5003  * A menu event is encoded as K_SPECIAL, KS_MENU, KE_FILLER followed by
5004  * four bytes which are to be taken as a pointer to the vimmenu_T
5005  * structure.
5006  *
5007  * A tab line event is encoded as K_SPECIAL KS_TABLINE nr, where "nr"
5008  * is one byte with the tab index.
5009  *
5010  * A scrollbar event is K_SPECIAL, KS_VER_SCROLLBAR, KE_FILLER followed
5011  * by one byte representing the scrollbar number, and then four bytes
5012  * representing a long_u which is the new value of the scrollbar.
5013  *
5014  * A horizontal scrollbar event is K_SPECIAL, KS_HOR_SCROLLBAR,
5015  * KE_FILLER followed by four bytes representing a long_u which is the
5016  * new value of the scrollbar.
5017  */
5018 # ifdef FEAT_MENU
5019  else if (key_name[0] == (int)KS_MENU)
5020  {
5021  long_u val;
5022  int num_bytes = get_long_from_buf(tp + slen, &val);
5023 
5024  if (num_bytes == -1)
5025  return -1;
5026  current_menu = (vimmenu_T *)val;
5027  slen += num_bytes;
5028 
5029  /* The menu may have been deleted right after it was used, check
5030  * for that. */
5031  if (check_menu_pointer(root_menu, current_menu) == FAIL)
5032  {
5033  key_name[0] = KS_EXTRA;
5034  key_name[1] = (int)KE_IGNORE;
5035  }
5036  }
5037 # endif
5038 # ifdef FEAT_GUI_TABLINE
5039  else if (key_name[0] == (int)KS_TABLINE)
5040  {
5041  // Selecting tabline tab or using its menu.
5042  char_u bytes[6];
5043  int num_bytes = get_bytes_from_buf(tp + slen, bytes, 1);
5044 
5045  if (num_bytes == -1)
5046  return -1;
5047  current_tab = (int)bytes[0];
5048  if (current_tab == 255) /* -1 in a byte gives 255 */
5049  current_tab = -1;
5050  slen += num_bytes;
5051  }
5052  else if (key_name[0] == (int)KS_TABMENU)
5053  {
5054  // Selecting tabline tab or using its menu.
5055  char_u bytes[6];
5056  int num_bytes = get_bytes_from_buf(tp + slen, bytes, 2);
5057 
5058  if (num_bytes == -1)
5059  return -1;
5060  current_tab = (int)bytes[0];
5061  current_tabmenu = (int)bytes[1];
5062  slen += num_bytes;
5063  }
5064 # endif
5065 # ifndef USE_ON_FLY_SCROLL
5066  else if (key_name[0] == (int)KS_VER_SCROLLBAR)
5067  {
5068  long_u val;
5069  char_u bytes[6];
5070  int num_bytes;
5071 
5072  /* Get the last scrollbar event in the queue of the same type */
5073  j = 0;
5074  for (i = 0; tp[j] == CSI && tp[j + 1] == KS_VER_SCROLLBAR
5075  && tp[j + 2] != NUL; ++i)
5076  {
5077  j += 3;
5078  num_bytes = get_bytes_from_buf(tp + j, bytes, 1);
5079  if (num_bytes == -1)
5080  break;
5081  if (i == 0)
5082  current_scrollbar = (int)bytes[0];
5083  else if (current_scrollbar != (int)bytes[0])
5084  break;
5085  j += num_bytes;
5086  num_bytes = get_long_from_buf(tp + j, &val);
5087  if (num_bytes == -1)
5088  break;
5089  scrollbar_value = val;
5090  j += num_bytes;
5091  slen = j;
5092  }
5093  if (i == 0) /* not enough characters to make one */
5094  return -1;
5095  }
5096  else if (key_name[0] == (int)KS_HOR_SCROLLBAR)
5097  {
5098  long_u val;
5099  int num_bytes;
5100 
5101  /* Get the last horiz. scrollbar event in the queue */
5102  j = 0;
5103  for (i = 0; tp[j] == CSI && tp[j + 1] == KS_HOR_SCROLLBAR
5104  && tp[j + 2] != NUL; ++i)
5105  {
5106  j += 3;
5107  num_bytes = get_long_from_buf(tp + j, &val);
5108  if (num_bytes == -1)
5109  break;
5110  scrollbar_value = val;
5111  j += num_bytes;
5112  slen = j;
5113  }
5114  if (i == 0) /* not enough characters to make one */
5115  return -1;
5116  }
5117 # endif /* !USE_ON_FLY_SCROLL */
5118 #endif /* FEAT_GUI */
5119 
5120  /*
5121  * Change <xHome> to <Home>, <xUp> to <Up>, etc.
5122  */
5123  key = handle_x_keys(TERMCAP2KEY(key_name[0], key_name[1]));
5124 
5125  /*
5126  * Add any modifier codes to our string.
5127  */
5128  new_slen = 0; /* Length of what will replace the termcode */
5129  if (modifiers != 0)
5130  {
5131  /* Some keys have the modifier included. Need to handle that here
5132  * to make mappings work. */
5133  key = simplify_key(key, &modifiers);
5134  if (modifiers != 0)
5135  {
5136  string[new_slen++] = K_SPECIAL;
5137  string[new_slen++] = (int)KS_MODIFIER;
5138  string[new_slen++] = modifiers;
5139  }
5140  }
5141 
5142  /* Finally, add the special key code to our string */
5143  key_name[0] = KEY2TERMCAP0(key);
5144  key_name[1] = KEY2TERMCAP1(key);
5145  if (key_name[0] == KS_KEY)
5146  {
5147  /* from ":set <M-b>=xx" */
5148  if (has_mbyte)
5149  new_slen += (*mb_char2bytes)(key_name[1], string + new_slen);
5150  else
5151  string[new_slen++] = key_name[1];
5152  }
5153  else if (new_slen == 0 && key_name[0] == KS_EXTRA
5154  && key_name[1] == KE_IGNORE)
5155  {
5156  /* Do not put K_IGNORE into the buffer, do return KEYLEN_REMOVED
5157  * to indicate what happened. */
5158  retval = KEYLEN_REMOVED;
5159  }
5160  else
5161  {
5162  string[new_slen++] = K_SPECIAL;
5163  string[new_slen++] = key_name[0];
5164  string[new_slen++] = key_name[1];
5165  }
5166  string[new_slen] = NUL;
5167  extra = new_slen - slen;
5168  if (buf == NULL)
5169  {
5170  if (extra < 0)
5171  /* remove matched chars, taking care of noremap */
5172  del_typebuf(-extra, offset);
5173  else if (extra > 0)
5174  /* insert the extra space we need */
5175  ins_typebuf(string + slen, REMAP_YES, offset, FALSE, FALSE);
5176 
5177  /*
5178  * Careful: del_typebuf() and ins_typebuf() may have reallocated
5179  * typebuf.tb_buf[]!
5180  */
5181  mch_memmove(typebuf.tb_buf + typebuf.tb_off + offset, string,
5182  (size_t)new_slen);
5183  }
5184  else
5185  {
5186  if (extra < 0)
5187  /* remove matched characters */
5188  mch_memmove(buf + offset, buf + offset - extra,
5189  (size_t)(*buflen + offset + extra));
5190  else if (extra > 0)
5191  {
5192  /* Insert the extra space we need. If there is insufficient
5193  * space return -1. */
5194  if (*buflen + extra + new_slen >= bufsize)
5195  return -1;
5196  mch_memmove(buf + offset + extra, buf + offset,
5197  (size_t)(*buflen - offset));
5198  }
5199  mch_memmove(buf + offset, string, (size_t)new_slen);
5200  *buflen = *buflen + extra + new_slen;
5201  }
5202  return retval == 0 ? (len + extra + offset) : retval;
5203  }
5204 
5205 #ifdef FEAT_TERMRESPONSE
5206  LOG_TR(("normal character"));
5207 #endif
5208 
5209  return 0; /* no match found */
5210 }
5211 
5212 #if (defined(FEAT_TERMINAL) && defined(FEAT_TERMRESPONSE)) || defined(PROTO)
5213 /*
5214  * Get the text foreground color, if known.
5215  */
5216  void
5217 term_get_fg_color(char_u *r, char_u *g, char_u *b)
5218 {
5219  if (rfg_status.tr_progress == STATUS_GOT)
5220  {
5221  *r = fg_r;
5222  *g = fg_g;
5223  *b = fg_b;
5224  }
5225 }
5226 
5227 /*
5228  * Get the text background color, if known.
5229  */
5230  void
5231 term_get_bg_color(char_u *r, char_u *g, char_u *b)
5232 {
5233  if (rbg_status.tr_progress == STATUS_GOT)
5234  {
5235  *r = bg_r;
5236  *g = bg_g;
5237  *b = bg_b;
5238  }
5239 }
5240 #endif
5241 
5242 /*
5243  * Replace any terminal code strings in from[] with the equivalent internal
5244  * vim representation. This is used for the "from" and "to" part of a
5245  * mapping, and the "to" part of a menu command.
5246  * Any strings like "<C-UP>" are also replaced, unless 'cpoptions' contains
5247  * '<'.
5248  * K_SPECIAL by itself is replaced by K_SPECIAL KS_SPECIAL KE_FILLER.
5249  *
5250  * The replacement is done in result[] and finally copied into allocated
5251  * memory. If this all works well *bufp is set to the allocated memory and a
5252  * pointer to it is returned. If something fails *bufp is set to NULL and from
5253  * is returned.
5254  *
5255  * CTRL-V characters are removed. When "from_part" is TRUE, a trailing CTRL-V
5256  * is included, otherwise it is removed (for ":map xx ^V", maps xx to
5257  * nothing). When 'cpoptions' does not contain 'B', a backslash can be used
5258  * instead of a CTRL-V.
5259  */
5260  char_u *
5261 replace_termcodes(
5262  char_u *from,
5263  char_u **bufp,
5264  int from_part,
5265  int do_lt, /* also translate <lt> */
5266  int special) /* always accept <key> notation */
5267 {
5268  int i;
5269  int slen;
5270  int key;
5271  int dlen = 0;
5272  char_u *src;
5273  int do_backslash; /* backslash is a special character */
5274  int do_special; /* recognize <> key codes */
5275  int do_key_code; /* recognize raw key codes */
5276  char_u *result; /* buffer for resulting string */
5277 
5278  do_backslash = (vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_BSLASH) == NULL);
5279  do_special = (vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_SPECI) == NULL) || special;
5280  do_key_code = (vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_KEYCODE) == NULL);
5281 
5282  /*
5283  * Allocate space for the translation. Worst case a single character is
5284  * replaced by 6 bytes (shifted special key), plus a NUL at the end.
5285  */
5286  result = alloc(STRLEN(from) * 6 + 1);
5287  if (result == NULL) /* out of memory */
5288  {
5289  *bufp = NULL;
5290  return from;
5291  }
5292 
5293  src = from;
5294 
5295  /*
5296  * Check for #n at start only: function key n
5297  */
5298  if (from_part && src[0] == '#' && VIM_ISDIGIT(src[1])) /* function key */
5299  {
5300  result[dlen++] = K_SPECIAL;
5301  result[dlen++] = 'k';
5302  if (src[1] == '0')
5303  result[dlen++] = ';'; /* #0 is F10 is "k;" */
5304  else
5305  result[dlen++] = src[1]; /* #3 is F3 is "k3" */
5306  src += 2;
5307  }
5308 
5309  /*
5310  * Copy each byte from *from to result[dlen]
5311  */
5312  while (*src != NUL)
5313  {
5314  /*
5315  * If 'cpoptions' does not contain '<', check for special key codes,
5316  * like "<C-S-LeftMouse>"
5317  */
5318  if (do_special && (do_lt || STRNCMP(src, "<lt>", 4) != 0))
5319  {
5320 #ifdef FEAT_EVAL
5321  /*
5322  * Replace <SID> by K_SNR <script-nr> _.
5323  * (room: 5 * 6 = 30 bytes; needed: 3 + <nr> + 1 <= 14)
5324  */
5325  if (STRNICMP(src, "<SID>", 5) == 0)
5326  {
5327  if (current_sctx.sc_sid <= 0)
5328  emsg(_(e_usingsid));
5329  else
5330  {
5331  src += 5;
5332  result[dlen++] = K_SPECIAL;
5333  result[dlen++] = (int)KS_EXTRA;
5334  result[dlen++] = (int)KE_SNR;
5335  sprintf((char *)result + dlen, "%ld",
5336  (long)current_sctx.sc_sid);
5337  dlen += (int)STRLEN(result + dlen);
5338  result[dlen++] = '_';
5339  continue;
5340  }
5341  }
5342 #endif
5343 
5344  slen = trans_special(&src, result + dlen, TRUE, FALSE);
5345  if (slen)
5346  {
5347  dlen += slen;
5348  continue;
5349  }
5350  }
5351 
5352  /*
5353  * If 'cpoptions' does not contain 'k', see if it's an actual key-code.
5354  * Note that this is also checked after replacing the <> form.
5355  * Single character codes are NOT replaced (e.g. ^H or DEL), because
5356  * it could be a character in the file.
5357  */
5358  if (do_key_code)
5359  {
5360  i = find_term_bykeys(src);
5361  if (i >= 0)
5362  {
5363  result[dlen++] = K_SPECIAL;
5364  result[dlen++] = termcodes[i].name[0];
5365  result[dlen++] = termcodes[i].name[1];
5366  src += termcodes[i].len;
5367  /* If terminal code matched, continue after it. */
5368  continue;
5369  }
5370  }
5371 
5372 #ifdef FEAT_EVAL
5373  if (do_special)
5374  {
5375  char_u *p, *s, len;
5376 
5377  /*
5378  * Replace <Leader> by the value of "mapleader".
5379  * Replace <LocalLeader> by the value of "maplocalleader".
5380  * If "mapleader" or "maplocalleader" isn't set use a backslash.
5381  */
5382  if (STRNICMP(src, "<Leader>", 8) == 0)
5383  {
5384  len = 8;
5385  p = get_var_value((char_u *)"g:mapleader");
5386  }
5387  else if (STRNICMP(src, "<LocalLeader>", 13) == 0)
5388  {
5389  len = 13;
5390  p = get_var_value((char_u *)"g:maplocalleader");
5391  }
5392  else
5393  {
5394  len = 0;
5395  p = NULL;
5396  }
5397  if (len != 0)
5398  {
5399  /* Allow up to 8 * 6 characters for "mapleader". */
5400  if (p == NULL || *p == NUL || STRLEN(p) > 8 * 6)
5401  s = (char_u *)"\\";
5402  else
5403  s = p;
5404  while (*s != NUL)
5405  result[dlen++] = *s++;
5406  src += len;
5407  continue;
5408  }
5409  }
5410 #endif
5411 
5412  /*
5413  * Remove CTRL-V and ignore the next character.
5414  * For "from" side the CTRL-V at the end is included, for the "to"
5415  * part it is removed.
5416  * If 'cpoptions' does not contain 'B', also accept a backslash.
5417  */
5418  key = *src;
5419  if (key == Ctrl_V || (do_backslash && key == '\\'))
5420  {
5421  ++src; /* skip CTRL-V or backslash */
5422  if (*src == NUL)
5423  {
5424  if (from_part)
5425  result[dlen++] = key;
5426  break;
5427  }
5428  }
5429 
5430  /* skip multibyte char correctly */
5431  for (i = (*mb_ptr2len)(src); i > 0; --i)
5432  {
5433  /*
5434  * If the character is K_SPECIAL, replace it with K_SPECIAL
5435  * KS_SPECIAL KE_FILLER.
5436  * If compiled with the GUI replace CSI with K_CSI.
5437  */
5438  if (*src == K_SPECIAL)
5439  {
5440  result[dlen++] = K_SPECIAL;
5441  result[dlen++] = KS_SPECIAL;
5442  result[dlen++] = KE_FILLER;
5443  }
5444 # ifdef FEAT_GUI
5445  else if (*src == CSI)
5446  {
5447  result[dlen++] = K_SPECIAL;
5448  result[dlen++] = KS_EXTRA;
5449  result[dlen++] = (int)KE_CSI;
5450  }
5451 # endif
5452  else
5453  result[dlen++] = *src;
5454  ++src;
5455  }
5456  }
5457  result[dlen] = NUL;
5458 
5459  /*
5460  * Copy the new string to allocated memory.
5461  * If this fails, just return from.
5462  */
5463  if ((*bufp = vim_strsave(result)) != NULL)
5464  from = *bufp;
5465  vim_free(result);
5466  return from;
5467 }
5468 
5469 /*
5470  * Find a termcode with keys 'src' (must be NUL terminated).
5471  * Return the index in termcodes[], or -1 if not found.
5472  */
5473  static int
5474 find_term_bykeys(char_u *src)
5475 {
5476  int i;
5477  int slen = (int)STRLEN(src);
5478 
5479  for (i = 0; i < tc_len; ++i)
5480  {
5481  if (slen == termcodes[i].len
5482  && STRNCMP(termcodes[i].code, src, (size_t)slen) == 0)
5483  return i;
5484  }
5485  return -1;
5486 }
5487 
5488 /*
5489  * Gather the first characters in the terminal key codes into a string.
5490  * Used to speed up check_termcode().
5491  */
5492  static void
5493 gather_termleader(void)
5494 {
5495  int i;
5496  int len = 0;
5497 
5498 #ifdef FEAT_GUI
5499  if (gui.in_use)
5500  termleader[len++] = CSI; /* the GUI codes are not in termcodes[] */
5501 #endif
5502 #ifdef FEAT_TERMRESPONSE
5503  if (check_for_codes || *T_CRS != NUL)
5504  termleader[len++] = DCS; /* the termcode response starts with DCS
5505  in 8-bit mode */
5506 #endif
5507  termleader[len] = NUL;
5508 
5509  for (i = 0; i < tc_len; ++i)
5510  if (vim_strchr(termleader, termcodes[i].code[0]) == NULL)
5511  {
5512  termleader[len++] = termcodes[i].code[0];
5513  termleader[len] = NUL;
5514  }
5515 
5516  need_gather = FALSE;
5517 }
5518 
5519 /*
5520  * Show all termcodes (for ":set termcap")
5521  * This code looks a lot like showoptions(), but is different.
5522  */
5523  void
5524 show_termcodes(void)
5525 {
5526  int col;
5527  int *items;
5528  int item_count;
5529  int run;
5530  int row, rows;
5531  int cols;
5532  int i;
5533  int len;
5534 
5535 #define INC3 27 /* try to make three columns */
5536 #define INC2 40 /* try to make two columns */
5537 #define GAP 2 /* spaces between columns */
5538 
5539  if (tc_len == 0) /* no terminal codes (must be GUI) */
5540  return;
5541  items = ALLOC_MULT(int, tc_len);
5542  if (items == NULL)
5543  return;
5544 
5545  /* Highlight title */
5546  msg_puts_title(_("\n--- Terminal keys ---"));
5547 
5548  /*
5549  * do the loop two times:
5550  * 1. display the short items (non-strings and short strings)
5551  * 2. display the medium items (medium length strings)
5552  * 3. display the long items (remaining strings)
5553  */
5554  for (run = 1; run <= 3 && !got_int; ++run)
5555  {
5556  /*
5557  * collect the items in items[]
5558  */
5559  item_count = 0;
5560  for (i = 0; i < tc_len; i++)
5561  {
5562  len = show_one_termcode(termcodes[i].name,
5563  termcodes[i].code, FALSE);
5564  if (len <= INC3 - GAP ? run == 1
5565  : len <= INC2 - GAP ? run == 2
5566  : run == 3)
5567  items[item_count++] = i;
5568  }
5569 
5570  /*
5571  * display the items
5572  */
5573  if (run <= 2)
5574  {
5575  cols = (Columns + GAP) / (run == 1 ? INC3 : INC2);
5576  if (cols == 0)
5577  cols = 1;
5578  rows = (item_count + cols - 1) / cols;
5579  }
5580  else /* run == 3 */
5581  rows = item_count;
5582  for (row = 0; row < rows && !got_int; ++row)
5583  {
5584  msg_putchar('\n'); /* go to next line */
5585  if (got_int) /* 'q' typed in more */
5586  break;
5587  col = 0;
5588  for (i = row; i < item_count; i += rows)
5589  {
5590  msg_col = col; /* make columns */
5591  show_one_termcode(termcodes[items[i]].name,
5592  termcodes[items[i]].code, TRUE);
5593  if (run == 2)
5594  col += INC2;
5595  else
5596  col += INC3;
5597  }
5598  out_flush();
5599  ui_breakcheck();
5600  }
5601  }
5602  vim_free(items);
5603 }
5604 
5605 /*
5606  * Show one termcode entry.
5607  * Output goes into IObuff[]
5608  */
5609  int
5610 show_one_termcode(char_u *name, char_u *code, int printit)
5611 {
5612  char_u *p;
5613  int len;
5614 
5615  if (name[0] > '~')
5616  {
5617  IObuff[0] = ' ';
5618  IObuff[1] = ' ';
5619  IObuff[2] = ' ';
5620  IObuff[3] = ' ';
5621  }
5622  else
5623  {
5624  IObuff[0] = 't';
5625  IObuff[1] = '_';
5626  IObuff[2] = name[0];
5627  IObuff[3] = name[1];
5628  }
5629  IObuff[4] = ' ';
5630 
5631  p = get_special_key_name(TERMCAP2KEY(name[0], name[1]), 0);
5632  if (p[1] != 't')
5633  STRCPY(IObuff + 5, p);
5634  else
5635  IObuff[5] = NUL;
5636  len = (int)STRLEN(IObuff);
5637  do
5638  IObuff[len++] = ' ';
5639  while (len < 17);
5640  IObuff[len] = NUL;
5641  if (code == NULL)
5642  len += 4;
5643  else
5644  len += vim_strsize(code);
5645 
5646  if (printit)
5647  {
5648  msg_puts((char *)IObuff);
5649  if (code == NULL)
5650  msg_puts("NULL");
5651  else
5652  msg_outtrans(code);
5653  }
5654  return len;
5655 }
5656 
5657 #if defined(FEAT_TERMRESPONSE) || defined(PROTO)
5658 /*
5659  * For Xterm >= 140 compiled with OPT_TCAP_QUERY: Obtain the actually used
5660  * termcap codes from the terminal itself.
5661  * We get them one by one to avoid a very long response string.
5662  */
5663 static int xt_index_in = 0;
5664 static int xt_index_out = 0;
5665 
5666  static void
5667 req_codes_from_term(void)
5668 {
5669  xt_index_out = 0;
5670  xt_index_in = 0;
5671  req_more_codes_from_term();
5672 }
5673 
5674  static void
5675 req_more_codes_from_term(void)
5676 {
5677  char buf[11];
5678  int old_idx = xt_index_out;
5679 
5680  /* Don't do anything when going to exit. */
5681  if (exiting)
5682  return;
5683 
5684  /* Send up to 10 more requests out than we received. Avoid sending too
5685  * many, there can be a buffer overflow somewhere. */
5686  while (xt_index_out < xt_index_in + 10 && key_names[xt_index_out] != NULL)
5687  {
5688  char *key_name = key_names[xt_index_out];
5689 
5690  LOG_TR(("Requesting XT %d: %s", xt_index_out, key_name));
5691  sprintf(buf, "\033P+q%02x%02x\033\\", key_name[0], key_name[1]);
5692  out_str_nf((char_u *)buf);
5693  ++xt_index_out;
5694  }
5695 
5696  /* Send the codes out right away. */
5697  if (xt_index_out != old_idx)
5698  out_flush();
5699 }
5700 
5701 /*
5702  * Decode key code response from xterm: '<Esc>P1+r<name>=<string><Esc>\'.
5703  * A "0" instead of the "1" indicates a code that isn't supported.
5704  * Both <name> and <string> are encoded in hex.
5705  * "code" points to the "0" or "1".
5706  */
5707  static void
5708 got_code_from_term(char_u *code, int len)
5709 {
5710 #define XT_LEN 100
5711  char_u name[3];
5712  char_u str[XT_LEN];
5713  int i;
5714  int j = 0;
5715  int c;
5716 
5717  /* A '1' means the code is supported, a '0' means it isn't.
5718  * When half the length is > XT_LEN we can't use it.
5719  * Our names are currently all 2 characters. */
5720  if (code[0] == '1' && code[7] == '=' && len / 2 < XT_LEN)
5721  {
5722  /* Get the name from the response and find it in the table. */
5723  name[0] = hexhex2nr(code + 3);
5724  name[1] = hexhex2nr(code + 5);
5725  name[2] = NUL;
5726  for (i = 0; key_names[i] != NULL; ++i)
5727  {
5728  if (STRCMP(key_names[i], name) == 0)
5729  {
5730  xt_index_in = i;
5731  break;
5732  }
5733  }
5734 
5735  LOG_TR(("Received XT %d: %s", xt_index_in, (char *)name));
5736 
5737  if (key_names[i] != NULL)
5738  {
5739  for (i = 8; (c = hexhex2nr(code + i)) >= 0; i += 2)
5740  str[j++] = c;
5741  str[j] = NUL;
5742  if (name[0] == 'C' && name[1] == 'o')
5743  {
5744  /* Color count is not a key code. */
5745  i = atoi((char *)str);
5746  may_adjust_color_count(i);
5747  }
5748  else
5749  {
5750  /* First delete any existing entry with the same code. */
5751  i = find_term_bykeys(str);
5752  if (i >= 0)
5753  del_termcode_idx(i);
5754  add_termcode(name, str, ATC_FROM_TERM);
5755  }
5756  }
5757  }
5758 
5759  /* May request more codes now that we received one. */
5760  ++xt_index_in;
5761  req_more_codes_from_term();
5762 }
5763 
5764 /*
5765  * Check if there are any unanswered requests and deal with them.
5766  * This is called before starting an external program or getting direct
5767  * keyboard input. We don't want responses to be send to that program or
5768  * handled as typed text.
5769  */
5770  static void
5771 check_for_codes_from_term(void)
5772 {
5773  int c;
5774 
5775  /* If no codes requested or all are answered, no need to wait. */
5776  if (xt_index_out == 0 || xt_index_out == xt_index_in)
5777  return;
5778 
5779  /* Vgetc() will check for and handle any response.
5780  * Keep calling vpeekc() until we don't get any responses. */
5781  ++no_mapping;
5782  ++allow_keys;
5783  for (;;)
5784  {
5785  c = vpeekc();
5786  if (c == NUL) /* nothing available */
5787  break;
5788 
5789  /* If a response is recognized it's replaced with K_IGNORE, must read
5790  * it from the input stream. If there is no K_IGNORE we can't do
5791  * anything, break here (there might be some responses further on, but
5792  * we don't want to throw away any typed chars). */
5793  if (c != K_SPECIAL && c != K_IGNORE)
5794  break;
5795  c = vgetc();
5796  if (c != K_IGNORE)
5797  {
5798  vungetc(c);
5799  break;
5800  }
5801  }
5802  --no_mapping;
5803  --allow_keys;
5804 }
5805 #endif
5806 
5807 /*
5808  * Translate an internal mapping/abbreviation representation into the
5809  * corresponding external one recognized by :map/:abbrev commands.
5810  * Respects the current B/k/< settings of 'cpoption'.
5811  *
5812  * This function is called when expanding mappings/abbreviations on the
5813  * command-line.
5814  *
5815  * It uses a growarray to build the translation string since the latter can be
5816  * wider than the original description. The caller has to free the string
5817  * afterwards.
5818  *
5819  * Returns NULL when there is a problem.
5820  */
5821  char_u *
5822 translate_mapping(char_u *str)
5823 {
5824  garray_T ga;
5825  int c;
5826  int modifiers;
5827  int cpo_bslash;
5828  int cpo_special;
5829 
5830  ga_init(&ga);
5831  ga.ga_itemsize = 1;
5832  ga.ga_growsize = 40;
5833 
5834  cpo_bslash = (vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_BSLASH) != NULL);
5835  cpo_special = (vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_SPECI) != NULL);
5836 
5837  for (; *str; ++str)
5838  {
5839  c = *str;
5840  if (c == K_SPECIAL && str[1] != NUL && str[2] != NUL)
5841  {
5842  modifiers = 0;
5843  if (str[1] == KS_MODIFIER)
5844  {
5845  str++;
5846  modifiers = *++str;
5847  c = *++str;
5848  }
5849  if (c == K_SPECIAL && str[1] != NUL && str[2] != NUL)
5850  {
5851  if (cpo_special)
5852  {
5853  ga_clear(&ga);
5854  return NULL;
5855  }
5856  c = TO_SPECIAL(str[1], str[2]);
5857  if (c == K_ZERO) /* display <Nul> as ^@ */
5858  c = NUL;
5859  str += 2;
5860  }
5861  if (IS_SPECIAL(c) || modifiers) /* special key */
5862  {
5863  if (cpo_special)
5864  {
5865  ga_clear(&ga);
5866  return NULL;
5867  }
5868  ga_concat(&ga, get_special_key_name(c, modifiers));
5869  continue; /* for (str) */
5870  }
5871  }
5872  if (c == ' ' || c == '\t' || c == Ctrl_J || c == Ctrl_V
5873  || (c == '<' && !cpo_special) || (c == '\\' && !cpo_bslash))
5874  ga_append(&ga, cpo_bslash ? Ctrl_V : '\\');
5875  if (c)
5876  ga_append(&ga, c);
5877  }
5878  ga_append(&ga, NUL);
5879  return (char_u *)(ga.ga_data);
5880 }
5881 
5882 #if (defined(MSWIN) && (!defined(FEAT_GUI) || defined(VIMDLL))) || defined(PROTO)
5883 static char ksme_str[20];
5884 static char ksmr_str[20];
5885 static char ksmd_str[20];
5886 
5887 /*
5888  * For Win32 console: update termcap codes for existing console attributes.
5889  */
5890  void
5891 update_tcap(int attr)
5892 {
5893  struct builtin_term *p;
5894 
5895  p = find_builtin_term(DEFAULT_TERM);
5896  sprintf(ksme_str, IF_EB("\033|%dm", ESC_STR "|%dm"), attr);
5897  sprintf(ksmd_str, IF_EB("\033|%dm", ESC_STR "|%dm"),
5898  attr | 0x08); /* FOREGROUND_INTENSITY */
5899  sprintf(ksmr_str, IF_EB("\033|%dm", ESC_STR "|%dm"),
5900  ((attr & 0x0F) << 4) | ((attr & 0xF0) >> 4));
5901 
5902  while (p->bt_string != NULL)
5903  {
5904  if (p->bt_entry == (int)KS_ME)
5905  p->bt_string = &ksme_str[0];
5906  else if (p->bt_entry == (int)KS_MR)
5907  p->bt_string = &ksmr_str[0];
5908  else if (p->bt_entry == (int)KS_MD)
5909  p->bt_string = &ksmd_str[0];
5910  ++p;
5911  }
5912 }
5913 
5914 # ifdef FEAT_TERMGUICOLORS
5915 # define KSSIZE 20
5916 struct ks_tbl_s
5917 {
5918  int code; // value of KS_
5919  char *vtp; // code in vtp mode
5920  char *vtp2; // code in vtp2 mode
5921  char buf[KSSIZE]; // save buffer in non-vtp mode
5922  char vbuf[KSSIZE]; // save buffer in vtp mode
5923  char v2buf[KSSIZE]; // save buffer in vtp2 mode
5924  char arr[KSSIZE]; // real buffer
5925 };
5926 
5927 static struct ks_tbl_s ks_tbl[] =
5928 {
5929  {(int)KS_ME, "\033|0m", "\033|0m"}, // normal
5930  {(int)KS_MR, "\033|7m", "\033|7m"}, // reverse
5931  {(int)KS_MD, "\033|1m", "\033|1m"}, // bold
5932  {(int)KS_SO, "\033|91m", "\033|91m"}, // standout: bright red text
5933  {(int)KS_SE, "\033|39m", "\033|39m"}, // standout end: default color
5934  {(int)KS_CZH, "\033|95m", "\033|95m"}, // italic: bright magenta text
5935  {(int)KS_CZR, "\033|0m", "\033|0m"}, // italic end
5936  {(int)KS_US, "\033|4m", "\033|4m"}, // underscore
5937  {(int)KS_UE, "\033|24m", "\033|24m"}, // underscore end
5938 # ifdef TERMINFO
5939  {(int)KS_CAB, "\033|%p1%db", "\033|%p14%dm"}, // set background color
5940  {(int)KS_CAF, "\033|%p1%df", "\033|%p13%dm"}, // set foreground color
5941  {(int)KS_CS, "\033|%p1%d;%p2%dR", "\033|%p1%d;%p2%dR"},
5942  {(int)KS_CSV, "\033|%p1%d;%p2%dV", "\033|%p1%d;%p2%dV"},
5943 # else
5944  {(int)KS_CAB, "\033|%db", "\033|4%dm"}, // set background color
5945  {(int)KS_CAF, "\033|%df", "\033|3%dm"}, // set foreground color
5946  {(int)KS_CS, "\033|%d;%dR", "\033|%d;%dR"},
5947  {(int)KS_CSV, "\033|%d;%dV", "\033|%d;%dV"},
5948 # endif
5949  {(int)KS_CCO, "256", "256"}, // colors
5950  {(int)KS_NAME} // terminator
5951 };

5953  static struct builtin_term *
5954 find_first_tcap(
5955  char_u *name,
5956  int code)
5957 {

5959

5967 /*
5968  * For Win32 console: replace the sequence immediately after termguicolors.
5969  */
5970  void
5971 swap_tcap(void)
5972 {
5973 # ifdef FEAT_TERMGUICOLORS
5974  static int init_done = FALSE;
5975  static int curr_mode;
5976  struct ks_tbl_s *ks;
5977  struct builtin_term *bt;
5978  int mode;
5979  enum
5980  {
5981  CMODEINDEX,
5982  CMODE24,
5983  CMODE256
5984  };
5985 
5986  /* buffer initialization */
5987  if (!init_done)
5988  {
5989  for (ks = ks_tbl; ks->code != (int)KS_NAME; ks++)
5990  {
5991  bt = find_first_tcap(DEFAULT_TERM, ks->code);
5992  if (bt != NULL)
5993  {
5994  STRNCPY(ks->buf, bt->bt_string, KSSIZE);
5995  STRNCPY(ks->vbuf, ks->vtp, KSSIZE);
5996  STRNCPY(ks->v2buf, ks->vtp2, KSSIZE);
5997 
5998  STRNCPY(ks->arr, bt->bt_string, KSSIZE);
5999  bt->bt_string = &ks->arr[0];
6000  }
6001  }
6002  init_done = TRUE;
6003  curr_mode = CMODEINDEX;
6004  }
6005 
6006  if (p_tgc)
6007  mode = CMODE24;
6008  else if (t_colors >= 256)
6009  mode = CMODE256;
6010  else
6011  mode = CMODEINDEX;
6012 
6013  for (ks = ks_tbl; ks->code != (int)KS_NAME; ks++)
6014  {
6015  bt = find_first_tcap(DEFAULT_TERM, ks->code);
6016  if (bt != NULL)
6017  {
6018  switch (curr_mode)
6019  {
6020  case CMODEINDEX:
6021  STRNCPY(&ks->buf[0], bt->bt_string, KSSIZE);
6022  break;
6023  case CMODE24:
6024  STRNCPY(&ks->vbuf[0], bt->bt_string, KSSIZE);
6025  break;
6026  default:
6027  STRNCPY(&ks->v2buf[0], bt->bt_string, KSSIZE);
6028  }
6029  }
6030  }
6031 
6032  if (mode != curr_mode)
6033  {
6034  for (ks = ks_tbl; ks->code != (int)KS_NAME; ks++)
6035  {
6036  bt = find_first_tcap(DEFAULT_TERM, ks->code);
6037  if (bt != NULL)
6038  {
6039  switch (mode)
6040  {
6041  case CMODEINDEX:
6042  STRNCPY(bt->bt_string, &ks->buf[0], KSSIZE);
6043  break;
6044  case CMODE24:
6045  STRNCPY(bt->bt_string, &ks->vbuf[0], KSSIZE);
6046  break;
6047  default:
6048  STRNCPY(bt->bt_string, &ks->v2buf[0], KSSIZE);
6049  }
6050  }
6051  }
6052 
6053  curr_mode = mode;
6054  }
6055 # endif
6056 }
6057 
6058 #endif

6060 #if defined(FEAT_GUI) || defined(FEAT_TERMGUICOLORS) || defined(PROTO)
6061  static int
6062 hex_digit(int c)
6063 {
6064  if (isdigit(c))
6065  return c - '0';
6066  c = TOLOWER_ASC(c);
6067  if (c >= 'a' && c <= 'f')
6068  return c - 'a' + 10;
6069  return 0x1ffffff;
6070 }

6074 gui_adjust_rgb(guicolor_T c)
6075 {
6076  if (gui.in_use)
6077  return c;
6078  else
6079  return ((c & 0xff) << 16) | (c & 0x00ff00) | ((c >> 16) & 0xff);
6080 }

6084 
6085  guicolor_T
6086 gui_get_color_cmn(char_u *name)
6087 {
6088  /* On MS-Windows an RGB macro is available and it produces 0x00bbggrr color
6089  * values as used by the MS-Windows GDI api. It should be used only for
6090  * MS-Windows GDI builds. */
6091 # if defined(RGB) && defined(MSWIN) && !defined(FEAT_GUI)
6092 # undef RGB
6093 # endif
6094 # ifndef RGB
6095 # define RGB(r, g, b) ((r<<16) | (g<<8) | (b))
6096 # endif
6097 # define LINE_LEN 100
6098  FILE *fd;
6099  char line[LINE_LEN];
6100  char_u *fname;
6101  int r, g, b, i;
6102  guicolor_T color;
6103 
6104  struct rgbcolor_table_S {
6105  char_u *color_name;
6106  guicolor_T color;
6107  };
6108 
6109  /* Only non X11 colors (not present in rgb.txt) and colors in
6110  * color_names[], useful when $VIMRUNTIME is not found,. */
6111  static struct rgbcolor_table_S rgb_table[] = {
6112  {(char_u *)"black", RGB(0x00, 0x00, 0x00)},
6113  {(char_u *)"blue", RGB(0x00, 0x00, 0xFF)},
6114  {(char_u *)"brown", RGB(0xA5, 0x2A, 0x2A)},
6115  {(char_u *)"cyan", RGB(0x00, 0xFF, 0xFF)},
6116  {(char_u *)"darkblue", RGB(0x00, 0x00, 0x8B)},
6117  {(char_u *)"darkcyan", RGB(0x00, 0x8B, 0x8B)},
6118  {(char_u *)"darkgray", RGB(0xA9, 0xA9, 0xA9)},
6119  {(char_u *)"darkgreen", RGB(0x00, 0x64, 0x00)},
6120  {(char_u *)"darkgrey", RGB(0xA9, 0xA9, 0xA9)},
6121  {(char_u *)"darkmagenta", RGB(0x8B, 0x00, 0x8B)},
6122  {(char_u *)"darkred", RGB(0x8B, 0x00, 0x00)},
6123  {(char_u *)"darkyellow", RGB(0x8B, 0x8B, 0x00)}, /* No X11 */
6124  {(char_u *)"gray", RGB(0xBE, 0xBE, 0xBE)},
6125  {(char_u *)"green", RGB(0x00, 0xFF, 0x00)},
6126  {(char_u *)"grey", RGB(0xBE, 0xBE, 0xBE)},
6127  {(char_u *)"grey40", RGB(0x66, 0x66, 0x66)},
6128  {(char_u *)"grey50", RGB(0x7F, 0x7F, 0x7F)},
6129  {(char_u *)"grey90", RGB(0xE5, 0xE5, 0xE5)},
6130  {(char_u *)"lightblue", RGB(0xAD, 0xD8, 0xE6)},
6131  {(char_u *)"lightcyan", RGB(0xE0, 0xFF, 0xFF)},
6132  {(char_u *)"lightgray", RGB(0xD3, 0xD3, 0xD3)},
6133  {(char_u *)"lightgreen", RGB(0x90, 0xEE, 0x90)},
6134  {(char_u *)"lightgrey", RGB(0xD3, 0xD3, 0xD3)},
6135  {(char_u *)"lightmagenta", RGB(0xFF, 0x8B, 0xFF)}, /* No X11 */
6136  {(char_u *)"lightred", RGB(0xFF, 0x8B, 0x8B)}, /* No X11 */
6137  {(char_u *)"lightyellow", RGB(0xFF, 0xFF, 0xE0)},
6138  {(char_u *)"magenta", RGB(0xFF, 0x00, 0xFF)},
6139  {(char_u *)"red", RGB(0xFF, 0x00, 0x00)},
6140  {(char_u *)"seagreen", RGB(0x2E, 0x8B, 0x57)},
6141  {(char_u *)"white", RGB(0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF)},
6142  {(char_u *)"yellow", RGB(0xFF, 0xFF, 0x00)},
6143  };
6144 
6145  static struct rgbcolor_table_S *colornames_table;
6146  static int size = 0;
6147 
6148  if (name[0] == '#' && STRLEN(name) == 7)
6149  {
6150  /* Name is in "#rrggbb" format */
6151  color = RGB(((hex_digit(name[1]) << 4) + hex_digit(name[2])),
6152  ((hex_digit(name[3]) << 4) + hex_digit(name[4])),
6153  ((hex_digit(name[5]) << 4) + hex_digit(name[6])));
6154  if (color > 0xffffff)
6155  return INVALCOLOR;
6156  return gui_adjust_rgb(color);
6157  }
6158 
6159  /* Check if the name is one of the colors we know */
6160  for (i = 0; i < (int)(sizeof(rgb_table) / sizeof(rgb_table[0])); i++)
6161  if (STRICMP(name, rgb_table[i].color_name) == 0)
6162  return gui_adjust_rgb(rgb_table[i].color);
6163 
6164  /*
6165  * Last attempt. Look in the file "$VIMRUNTIME/rgb.txt".
6166  */
6167  if (size == 0)
6168  {
6169  int counting;
6170 
6171  // colornames_table not yet initialized
6172  fname = expand_env_save((char_u *)"$VIMRUNTIME/rgb.txt");
6173  if (fname == NULL)
6174  return INVALCOLOR;
6175 
6176  fd = fopen((char *)fname, "rt");
6177  vim_free(fname);
6178  if (fd == NULL)
6179  {
6180  if (p_verbose > 1)
6181  verb_msg(_("Cannot open $VIMRUNTIME/rgb.txt"));
6182  size = -1; // don't try again
6183  return INVALCOLOR;
6184  }
6185 
6186  for (counting = 1; counting >= 0; --counting)
6187  {
6188  if (!counting)
6189  {
6190  colornames_table = ALLOC_MULT(struct rgbcolor_table_S, size);
6191  if (colornames_table == NULL)
6192  {
6193  fclose(fd);
6194  return INVALCOLOR;
6195  }
6196  rewind(fd);
6197  }
6198  size = 0;
6199 
6200  while (!feof(fd))
6201  {
6202  size_t len;
6203  int pos;
6204 
6205  vim_ignoredp = fgets(line, LINE_LEN, fd);
6206  len = strlen(line);
6207 
6208  if (len <= 1 || line[len - 1] != '\n')
6209  continue;
6210 
6211  line[len - 1] = '\0';
6212 
6213  i = sscanf(line, "%d %d %d %n", &r, &g, &b, &pos);
6214  if (i != 3)
6215  continue;
6216 
6217  if (!counting)
6218  {
6219  char_u *s = vim_strsave((char_u *)line + pos);
6220 
6221  if (s == NULL)
6222  {
6223  fclose(fd);
6224  return INVALCOLOR;
6225  }
6226  colornames_table[size].color_name = s;
6227  colornames_table[size].color = (guicolor_T)RGB(r, g, b);
6228  }
6229  size++;
6230 
6231  // The distributed rgb.txt has less than 1000 entries. Limit to
6232  // 10000, just in case the file was messed up.
6233  if (size == 10000)
6234  break;
6235  }
6236  }
6237  fclose(fd);
6238  }
6239 
6240  for (i = 0; i < size; i++)
6241  if (STRICMP(name, colornames_table[i].color_name) == 0)
6242  return gui_adjust_rgb(colornames_table[i].color);
6243 
6244  return INVALCOLOR;
6245 }
6246

6248 gui_get_rgb_color_cmn(int r, int g, int b)

6251

6253  return INVALCOLOR;
6254  return gui_adjust_rgb(color);
6255 }

6259  || defined(PROTO)
6260 static int cube_value[] = {
6261  0x00, 0x5F, 0x87, 0xAF, 0xD7, 0xFF

6264 static int grey_ramp[] = {
6265  0x08, 0x12, 0x1C, 0x26, 0x30, 0x3A, 0x44, 0x4E, 0x58, 0x62, 0x6C, 0x76,
6266  0x80, 0x8A, 0x94, 0x9E, 0xA8, 0xB2, 0xBC, 0xC6, 0xD0, 0xDA, 0xE4, 0xEE

6275 static char_u ansi_table[16][4] = {
6276 // R G B idx
6277  { 0, 0, 0, 1}, // black
6278  {224, 0, 0, 2}, // dark red
6279  { 0, 224, 0, 3}, // dark green
6280  {224, 224, 0, 4}, // dark yellow / brown
6281  { 0, 0, 224, 5}, // dark blue
6282  {224, 0, 224, 6}, // dark magenta
6283  { 0, 224, 224, 7}, // dark cyan
6284  {224, 224, 224, 8}, // light grey
6285

6289  {255, 255, 64, 12}, // yellow

6296  void
6297 cterm_color2rgb(int nr, char_u *r, char_u *g, char_u *b, char_u *ansi_idx)
6298 {
6299  int idx;
6300 
6301  if (nr < 16)
6302  {
6303  *r = ansi_table[nr][0];
6304  *g = ansi_table[nr][1];
6305  *b = ansi_table[nr][2];
6306  *ansi_idx = ansi_table[nr][3];
6307  }
6308  else if (nr < 232)
6309  {
6310  /* 216 color cube */
6311  idx = nr - 16;
6312  *r = cube_value[idx / 36 % 6];
6313  *g = cube_value[idx / 6 % 6];
6314  *b = cube_value[idx % 6];
6315  *ansi_idx = VTERM_ANSI_INDEX_NONE;
6316  }
6317  else if (nr < 256)
6318  {
6319  /* 24 grey scale ramp */
6320  idx = nr - 232;
6321  *r = grey_ramp[idx];
6322  *g = grey_ramp[idx];
6323  *b = grey_ramp[idx];
6324  *ansi_idx = VTERM_ANSI_INDEX_NONE;
6325  }
6326  else
6327  {
6328  *r = 0;
6329  *g = 0;
6330  *b = 0;
6331  *ansi_idx = 0;
6332  }
6333 }
6334 #endif
